segment.source: How to Recover a Moved Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Moved Drive

segment.source: This topic explains how to use the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) to recover an operating system drive that was moved after being encrypted by Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).
segment.target: This topic explains how to use the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) to recover an operating system drive that was moved after being encrypted by Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM).

segment.source: When a drive is moved, it no longer accepts the PIN that was used in the previous computer because the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip has changed.
segment.target: When a drive is moved, it no longer accepts the PIN that was used in the previous computer because the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip has changed.

segment.source: To recover the moved drive, you must obtain the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password.
segment.target: To recover the moved drive, you must obtain the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password.

segment.source: To recover a moved drive, you must use the Drive Recovery area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: To recover a moved drive, you must use the Drive Recovery area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: To access the Drive Recovery area, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.
segment.target: To access the Drive Recovery area, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.

segment.source: For more information about these roles, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.
segment.target: For more information about these roles, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You may have given these roles different names when you created them.
segment.target: You may have given these roles different names when you created them.

segment.source: For more information, see Access accounts for the Administration and Monitoring Website (Help Desk).
segment.target: For more information, see Access accounts for the Administration and Monitoring Website (Help Desk).

segment.source: To recover a moved drive
segment.target: To recover a moved drive

segment.source: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start the computer in Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).
segment.target: On the computer that contains the moved drive, start the computer in Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) mode, or start the computer by using the Microsoft Diagnostic and Recovery Toolset (DaRT).

segment.source: After the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, MBAM will treat the moved operating system drive as a fixed data drive.
segment.target: After the computer has been started with WinRE or DaRT, MBAM will treat the moved operating system drive as a fixed data drive.

segment.source: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.
segment.target: MBAM will then display the drive’s recovery password ID and ask for the recovery password.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In some cases, you may be able to click I forgot the PIN during the startup process, and then enter the recovery mode to display the recovery key ID.
segment.target: In some cases, you may be able to click I forgot the PIN during the startup process, and then enter the recovery mode to display the recovery key ID.

segment.source: Use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive from the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Use the recovery key ID to retrieve the recovery password and unlock the drive from the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: For instructions, see How to Recover a Drive in Recovery Mode.
segment.target: For instructions, see How to Recover a Drive in Recovery Mode.

segment.source: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, complete the following additional steps.
segment.target: If the moved drive was configured to use a TPM chip on the original computer, complete the following additional steps.

segment.source: Otherwise, the recovery process is complete.
segment.target: Otherwise, the recovery process is complete.

segment.source: After unlocking the drive and completing the start process, open a command prompt in WinRE mode and use the command to decrypt the drive.
segment.target: After unlocking the drive and completing the start process, open a command prompt in WinRE mode and use the command to decrypt the drive.

segment.source: Using this tool is the only way to remove the TPM plus the PIN protector without the original TPM chip.
segment.target: Using this tool is the only way to remove the TPM plus the PIN protector without the original TPM chip.

segment.source: For information about the command, see Manage-bde.
segment.target: For information about the command, see Manage-bde.

segment.source: When the removal is completed, start the computer normally.
segment.target: When the removal is completed, start the computer normally.

segment.source: The MBAM agent will now enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus the PIN.
segment.target: The MBAM agent will now enforce the policy to encrypt the drive with the new computer’s TPM plus the PIN.
